group_1.textRight: …We've defeated the Witch.
She just appeared out of nowhere…

group_1.narration: "She's a monster! A Rakshasi!"

group_1.textRight: They're throwing rocks at her?!@That's horrible!

group_1.narration: I'm sure the reason they all look@at me in terror is because@my magic has almost run out…

group_1.textRight: She's weaker than I thought!@She fell right over!

group_1.textLeft: C-cut that out!@Heruka's been fighting for—

group_1.textRight: Who are you?

group_1.textLeft: They're friends of Heruka!@Rakshasis, all of them!

group_1.textRight: Hrm?!

group_1.textLeft: Don't come any closer!@If you do…I'll use my magic on you!

group_1.textRight: Magic…? Are you going to put us@to sleep again…?
Heruka, hold onto me and let's get out of here!
NO! You're running away with me, NOW!
We'll hold them off so you can get@some distance.

group_1.textLeft: Wh-what are you…?@I'm not running away…

group_1.textRight: I'll drag you along if I have to!@C'mon!

group_1.textLeft: Wha…? The Rakshasi have escaped!@After them!

group_1.textRight: Not gonna happen.
…Inconceivable. You really let them escape?@Are you trying to rewrite history?

group_1.textLeft: History will not be rewritten…@Heruka will return.

group_1.textRight: Then why?

group_1.textLeft: We want to let Dolma do what she needs to do.
We can't just let that be their goodbye…

group_1.textRight: *Pant…* *Pant…*@This way!
I have no idea, but we gotta go as far@as we can…

group_1.narration: No matter how she supports me@and how much she walks,@this Mongolian land holds no refuge…@Even Dolma knows that.
Besides…I had no intention@of running away to begin with.

group_1.textRight: Heruka! Are you alright?!

group_1.narration: In truth, I lost the strength to stand.@I used all my magic to fight that Witch…@I was utterly spent.
It wouldn't be this way if I was stronger…@But it's fine. I was able to accomplish everything@in spite of my weakness.

group_1.textRight: You look so content…@You weren't planning on running, were you?

group_1.textLeft: Do you really think we can escape, Dolma?
Besides…there are things we can't run@away from.

group_1.textRight: …You're not going to lie to me anymore, right?

group_1.textLeft: Only if no one else is watching.

group_1.textRight: Then let's go even further, where we know@we'll be alone.
I don't want you to lie to me like that again,@not like this.
C'mon, let's go.@I'll help you walk.

group_1.narration: Yes. We know full well that we@can't run away or escape.
But even so, we continued to walk side by side.
Yes…we just want to be together@for every moment time allows.
I can hear the faint sounds@of the Mongolian soldiers off in the distance.@Soon they will catch up with us and detain me.
Until then, I'm going to stay with Dolma…@Surely I'll be forgiven for this much, right…?

group_1.textRight: We're through the woods, Heruka.
Huh…?

group_1.narration: The blue flowers of the nunnery were blooming@in splendor all across Mongolia.
They often bloomed in the area where we lived,@but it was never like this.
How is this possible…?
―Dolma―@Do you remember that time long ago where we went@to that field where all the flowers bloomed?
―Heruka―@Yes, I remember…@How nostalgic.
―Dolma―@It didn't mean anything back then, but these flowers…@Now they've become a symbol of you, Heruka.
―Heruka―@A symbol of me?@Because I've been growing them all my life?
―Dolma―@Yeah… That's why people who believe in you@offer their prayers to these flowers.
―Dolma―@They pray for peace.
―Dolma―@And just look at it now…@They're blooming all over Mongolia.
―Heruka―@And now they will burn me…@Because I'm a Rakshasi…
―Dolma―@Even so…you were the one who gave them@that wish…that hope…for peace.
―Dolma―@It all meant something in the end, didn't it…?@Your life meant something.
―Heruka―@This is…
―Dolma―@Yes… This is Shambhala.
―Heruka―@...Hey, Dolma…@I gave you your wish, didn't I?
―Heruka―@The war…is over now, right?
―Dolma―@Y…you did…for me?@You did all this for me, Heruka…?
―Heruka―@*Giggle* Sometimes it was to protect others,@and sometimes I was doing it for myself…
―Heruka―@But fundamentally, I did it because@you seemed to be in so much pain…
Back then, when you clung to me@and begged me for a way to end the war,@you looked so distressed that I wanted@nothing more than to help you.
I didn't want you to live in a world where@you could only live by clinging onto others.
―Heruka―@Are you happy…Dolma?@I…did my best.
―Dolma―@...
―Heruka―@...Are you not happy?
―Dolma―@Y-you… Why…@Why would you…?
―Dolma―@...You idiot.
Dolma desperately tried to endure whatever@it was she was feeling and smiled at me,@though she had tears in her eyes.
How strange…@I was supposed to make Dolma smile,@but why am I making her cry instead?
―Dolma―@I was happy to have you, Heruka, but after everyone@else was killed, I couldn't do things alone anymore.
―Dolma―@So I became dependent on you, and…@I'm sorry… This is all my fault…
―Heruka―@It's not your fault, Dolma…@I would have done this no matter what.
―Heruka―@Mongolia is powerful… There's no way we could win.@With my life, everyone will be saved.
―Heruka―@What could be better than that?@Ahaha…
The voices of the Mongolian soldiers@are drawing ever nearer.
Soon I will be caught and executed,@and my life will be cast behind…
Before I knew it, I was trembling.@I couldn't stop it.
―Heruka―@Ah…haha… That's funny…@I thought I had made my peace with it long ago…
―Heruka―@D-Dolma… I'm scared.
―Dolma―@...Yeah.
―Heruka―@Right now, I…I feel like a normal girl…@Ahaha…
―Dolma―@Yeah… It's okay…@It's fine, look, I'll give you a big hug…
―Heruka―@Dolma, I'm sorry… Why is this happening?@It's funny… Ehehe…
―Dolma―@Yeah… It is funny, Heruka.
And so we laughed together.@Even as I felt the presence@of the soldiers behind me…
We laughed all the way to the very end.
